result.execSummary:
The defendant Joey A Hoefs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/schooling or if not, 10 hours community service per week.

SAFE program. 

DNA sample.  

Letter of apology to alleged victims.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joey A Hoefs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Deft. to Court re:  no contact (stj)

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:38 pm 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person, pro se. 
Waiver of Right to Atty filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Harassment - Conduct or Acts)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: SAFE program; fulltime employment/schooling or if not, 10 hours CS per week; letter of apology to alleged victims; no contact with S.Ht; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked.  

Adj: 1:48 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Joey A Hoefs

Prior: 1510 Balsam Road, Stratford, WI 54484

No contact with victim(s): S.H.
Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
